translation1: "All Bosch electrical tools, pneumatic tools, and measuring instruments are carefully inspected, tested, and subject to strict quality controls by Bosch's quality assurance. translation1: "Tire choice for racing bike - really that safe from punctures? This morning I woke up full of motivation to prepare for my bicycle tour next week by at least a little training. Well, I said and did it, and I rode my racing bike, which I bought yesterday on eBay.The first 40km were really beautiful - but then something happened that lurks in every city center (this time: Thank you, Krefeld!). Glass shards on the route. Zack, loud hissing and my rear tire refused to participate in the rest of the journey on any account.Since I couldn't get a replacement tire and tube on account of the day of the week, I had to turn around half-heartedly and take the first train back home. It wasn't technically that bad, maybe it's better if I practice the tire change again before the bike ride. But now I'm facing a question and I hope you can help me.Since I have a relatively long distance to cover over several days, I would really rather not have this problem more often. Now it wasn't too bad, since the old tires from the previous owner (a very nice old man who rode 120km on them until 2pm on the day I picked up the bike) were also suboptimal, as he had been riding on them for several years. But if I think about the fact that I have to change the tire after 80-90km of riding, I am really in a bad mood :DNow I have struck up a conversation with an older man at the platform, who asked me curiously why I didn't have the Marathon Plus tires; they are supposed to be indestructible. Of course, this all sounds very tempting now. But are they really unbreakable?I have little desire to spend 40€/tire now, only to be disappointed in the end. Furthermore, I am asking myself: I currently have on my racing bike, I believe, 25x622. This is also available (apparently?) in the Marathon Plus tires, but the majority is already wider.Is this a problem? Or would you generally recommend me to other tires for a racing bike? The Schwalbe side seems to be my absolute favorite! My layman's knowledge rather leans towards recommending the Durano DD.Thank you in advance for your help and best regards!"
gpt_response: { "Cohesion": { "Lexical Cohesion Mistakes": [ "Overuse of the word 'tires' disrupting the flow of the text", "Use of 'bike ride' instead of 'bicycle tour' disrupting the consistency", "Use of the term 'Schwalbe side' instead of 'Schwalbe website'"; may cause confusion" ], "Grammatical Cohesion Mistakes": [ "Use of 'it' in 'It wasn't technically that bad' without a clear antecedent", "Use of 'I have struck up a conversation with an older man at the platform' instead of 'I just got into a discussion with an older man at the train platform'"] } }
reference: Picking tires for a road bike - life without popped tires? This morning I woke up with a fiery drive because I still wanted to at least train a bit in the upcoming weeks in preparation for my upcoming bicycle tour. It was as easy as that and I drove my road bike which I had bought on eBay the day before. The first 40 km were really beautiful - but then that happened which is always waiting for you in the intercity (this time: thanks goes to Krefeld!). Glass shards on the road. Pop, a loud hiss and my back tire was no longer up for riding the rest of the trip. Because of it being a work day, I didn’t really have the chance to acquire a spare tire and tube, I had to turn back halfway through in a bad mood and take the next workable train back home. It was not the worst downer ever, maybe it is even better if I practice changing tires one more time before I leave to go on the tour. But now I am posed with a question and hope that you will be able to help me. Because I have a relatively long stretch of road and many days in front of me, I would very much like to not run into this problem on a regular basis. This time it really wasn’t that bad, because the tires were from the previous owner (a very nice old man, who had already rode 120 km by 2 PM on the day I came to pick up my bicycle) and because he had described them as suboptimal, because he had already been wearing them down for many years. But if I think about having to change tires every 80-90 km on the tour, then I am already in a really bad mood :D I just got into a discussion with an older man at the train platform, who asked me quite surprised, why I don’t have the Marathon Plus tires, these are supposed to be impossible to pop. Now that certainly does sound tempting. But are they really so indestructible? I have no desire to give out €40 per tire in order to just be disappointed. At the same time, I ask myself: I am using 25x622 race tires at the moment, I believe. This is (apparently?) just like the Marathon Plus tires, but the majority of tires are actually wider. Is that the real problem? Or would you recommend that I really get different tires in general for the road bike? The Schwalbe website seems to be of one opinion! Would common sense tend to recommend the Durano DD? Thank you in advance for your help and take care!

translation1: "\"The party we wanted to throw\": Frankfurt celebrates after scoring-packed comeback against Leverkusen What a spectacular reaction from Eintracht Frankfurt. After 22 minutes, the Hessians, who had not won in their last two games, seemed to be on their way to another Bundesliga defeat.But then the SGE turned around, shook off the frustration of a mediocre start to the season within an hour, and won furiously with 5:2. \"It's crazy what the guys have done today,\" coach Oliver Glasner exclaimed on DAZN and gave a \"general praise\" to \"everyone who was involved.\" At first, it looked like another disappointment for the Frankfurt team, who are still behind their expectations in ninth place. Patrik Schick had put Leverkusen ahead 2:0.What then happened also impressed the SGE coach. \"How the players then came back and put on a fantastic performance,\" said Glasner further. I am incredibly happy with the performance we showed and of course also with the result.Even defender Christopher Lenz, who was able to play again for the first time since the fourth matchday and overcoming his muscle injury, emphasized the morale of his teammates. \"I believe our mentality is incredible,\" said the 27-year-old, looking forward to the result especially for the spectators. That was the party we wanted to throw today.For the upcoming tasks, Glasner will now keep the focus within himself, but he also feels well-prepared in terms of the personnel situation. It is extraordinary that we have all players fit in December, that all players are physically in top condition. It is top work in our medical department, but also the players are living highly professionally.Now, one wants to \"go step by step and remain humble\" and complete the tasks until the end of the year at this level. Next up, on Wednesday as part of the English week, there is an away game at Borussia Mönchengladbach (6:30 pm, Sky)."

reference: “A Party we wanted to throw”: Frankfurt is celebrating after a high scoring comeback against Leverkusen What a spectacular reaction from Eintracht Frankfurt. After 22 minutes, the team from Hessen, which had recently lost twice in a row, seemed to be on its way to its next soccer failure. But then the SGE turned themselves around and were able to shoot the frustration of a poor start to the season out of their soul within an hour, leading to a furious 5-2 victory. “It was crazy what the boys were able to accomplish today,” Coach Oliver Glasner said with jubilee at DAZN and spoke of “praise all around, to each and every one of them who were there”. At the beginning, it seemed like another setback for the team from Frankfurt, who are now at place nine and still not living up to their expectations. Defender Christopher Lenz, who was playing for the first time since the fourth game day and overcoming his muscle injury, really emphasized team moral. “I think that our mentality is unbelievably great”, the 27-year-old said and was happy after checking the scoreboard, especially how it effects the viewers. That was the party that we wanted to throw today. However, Glasner still wants to keep focused for the upcoming challenges, but sees himself well set when considering his personal situation. translation1: "Federal Minister of Construction Klara Geywitz: Enteignment does not create new housing The new Federal Minister of Construction Klara Geywitz (SPD) has spoken out against the expropriation of large housing corporations, as has been demanded in a Berlin popular vote. \"With expropriation, not a single new housing unit is created, only the structure of ownership changes,\" Geywitz said in an interview with the \"Tagesspiegel\" (Sunday).My goal is to give tenants security that their rent will remain affordable in the next few years. translation1: "I am fed up with Sky Sport F1 Hello dear F1 fans, over the course of the season, the quality on German Sky has decreased more and more, so I want to vent a bit with this post. First of all, the transmission was interrupted mid-F2 race today to start the F1 pre-coverage on time.Although the delayed start and the accident at the beginning had put the schedule far behind schedule, it was still possible to show the last (planned) ten minutes and the championship decision (!). Apparently, however, this is not possible for legal reasons, so that everything else has to be restricted, which is why Sky DE probably had no choice. Nevertheless, it is stupid, especially since Sky UK was able to broadcast the end of the race.Nevertheless, a small praise: commentator Olivier Zwartjes did a good job of accompanying the difficult situation around the heavy accident. Then there was rule ignorance among the F1 commentators Sascha Roos and Ralf Schumacher, as both did not know that you can change tires under a red flag. Although there were similar situations in Imola, Baku, and Silverstone this year, both only came to the conclusion that Verstappen was allowed to change tires when there were corresponding radio messages about Hamilton.At Sky UK and RTL, both commentators knew immediately that this was possible for Verstappen. In my opinion, such basic rules should simply be known if you commentate on F1 at a pay-TV broadcaster. It is also not the first puzzle-guessing, as now according to the rules, both have simply constant uncertainties in the subject of rules.I do not generally like the artificial commentary style of Roos, but I acknowledge that it is a matter of taste. However, I seriously prefer Heiko Wasser from RTL. In addition, there are constant silliness that both simply appear unprofessional, such as ordering coffee from (equally clueless) reporter Peter Hardenacke or \"UuuuuHD\" from Ralf Schumacher.Just the latter brings a lot of turmoil into the commentary, as he apparently does not take it seriously. Not least, advertising simply takes over at Sky, where in the final round, Sky is the only channel that goes into advertising, as can be heard on F1TV, where only the German audio track without commentary is available directly after the race. translation1: "By pressing the button, you can easily choose whether your \"Smart Stone\" should permanently shine in one color or play through its entire color palette. When the color change is activated, the light stone remains in a light color for about a minute before gently transitioning to the next decorative color. The solid construction of the \"Smart Stone\" light withstands the outdoors all year round.In a snow-covered environment, its light is particularly good - only with a shortened light duration can be expected when the days become shorter. reference: By pressing a button, you can easily select whether your “Smart Stone” will stay on one color or play out the entirety of its color repertoire. If it is set to change color, the stone keeps its color of light for about a minute before softly transferring over to the next decorative tone. The solid construction of the “Smart Stone” light keeps it protected outside the whole year through. In a snowy environment, the light is especially nice - although briefer light times should be expected as soon as the days get shorter. Please just make sure that the snow doesn’t effect the functioning of the solar module in winter. “Smart Stone” uses a NiMh battery in common format (“AA”), which can be switched out easily if needed. You can find the right replacement batteries in our online shop and thereby further lengthen the usage life of your decorative light.
